summary: This is a transcript of a voluntary, sworn interview conducted by the DOJ Office of the Inspector General with Federal Bureau of Prisons employee Michael Thomas on June 17, 2021. The interview concerns Thomas's alleged misconduct, including false statements, job performance failure, security failure, and reporting false information related to his duties at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, specifically surrounding the period when inmate Jeffrey Epstein was housed there. Thomas was assigned to the Special Housing Unit (SHU) on overtime shifts, including August 9 and 10, 2019, the morning Epstein was found deceased. The interview details Thomas's background, training, duties, his interactions with and observations of Epstein, the events of August 10, 2019, and his admission to falsifying count and round documentation on that date and on prior occasions.

events.title: Epstein Incident with Cellmate and Suicide Watch
events.description: An incident occurred in Epstein's cell involving cellmate Nicholas Tartaglione. Epstein claimed Tartaglione tried to harm him. Epstein was found with an orange homemade rope and was placed on suicide watch. Michael Thomas responded to the incident and later watched Epstein on suicide watch.

events.title: Removal of Cellmate Efren Reyes
events.description: Inmate Efren Reyes, who was Epstein's cellmate, was removed from the MCC. This left Epstein without a cellmate, despite a psychology email stating he needed to be housed with an appropriate cellmate after coming off psychological observation.

events.title: Discovery of Jeffrey Epstein Deceased
events.description: At approximately 6:33 a.m., during a meal delivery, Michael Thomas discovered Jeffrey Epstein hanging by a sheet from his bunk in his SHU cell. Thomas yelled for help, ripped the sheet down, and began chest compressions. A medical emergency was called, and life-saving efforts continued as Epstein was transported to the medical floor.

events.title: Failure to Conduct Rounds and Counts
events.description: During their shift from 12:00 a.m. to approximately 6:33 a.m. on August 10, 2019, Michael Thomas and Officer Noel did not conduct any of the required 30-minute rounds or the 12:00 a.m., 3:00 a.m., and 5:00 a.m. inmate counts in the SHU. They falsified the count slips and round sheets to indicate the counts and rounds were completed.

events.title: DOJ OIG Interview of Michael Thomas
events.description: The Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General conducted a voluntary, sworn interview with BOP employee Michael Thomas as part of an investigation into his alleged misconduct related to the Epstein case. Thomas admitted to falsifying count and round documentation on August 10, 2019, and on prior occasions.

locations: Special Housing Unit (SHU), 9th floor, MCC New York
Suicide Watch / Psychological Observation area, 2nd floor, MCC New York
Law Offices of Montel Figgins, Newark, New Jersey
keyFacts: Michael Thomas admitted that he and Officer Noel did not conduct any of the required inmate counts (12:00 a.m., 3:00 a.m., 5:00 a.m.) or 30-minute rounds during their shift in the SHU on August 10, 2019, and falsified the documentation.
Thomas admitted that prior to August 10, 2019, there were occasions during his 14-year BOP career where he certified that counts and rounds were conducted when they in fact were not.

Epstein was without a cellmate on August 10, 2019, after his cellmate Efren Reyes was removed on August 9, despite a psychology email requirement that he be housed with a cellmate after coming off psychological observation.
Thomas was the first to discover Epstein hanging in his cell, ripped the sheet down, and initiated chest compressions before medical staff arrived.
Thomas stated that no one ever provided him with special instructions regarding Epstein, told him Epstein was required to have a cellmate, or informed him to pay closer attention to Epstein.
